comments.commentBody: It will be important for Secretary Clinton to exceed 50% to definitively rebuke the Trump message.

Here's another way of looking at it.

On the eve of Brexit, betting markets were giving the Remain side an 85% chance of winning.

See how that worked out.

Elections are fascinating exercises in social natural selection. This tells me advancing intelligence in humans will win, thus Clinton. Don Trump's sizable showing tells me humanity is still a violent dangerous species.

I call it the wisdom of the masses. My hope is that it prevails.
The polls are VERY likely to be underestimating Trump support given how many people will be reluctant to admit to their support. Let's not count our chickens! Every vote will count.
This interesting compared to Predictit.org, which shows Clinton as a 75% favorite to win.
Presidential elections are not over until we the people, the registered voters cast our votes safely in the ballot box on November 08, 2016 about 80 days from now.

Never count your money
When your sittin' at the table
There're time enough for countin'
When the dealings done

https://youtu.be/gDwCMxPwJ_4

The problem is that the Times has a very poor record of forecasting Trump's many primary winnings.  Don't know what the issue is with the Times ratings but I am sure that he is more likely to win than the Times currently suggests. This is not based on any dogma but in the numbers you have projected in the Republican primary.  It seemed your were consistent in underestimating him, but I am not going to research the facts.  I am sure you know...
The media has been engaging in a blitzkrieg onslaught against Trump. If they fail to destroy him before the first debate Trump will prevail.

The NYtimes needs to stand aside and have a look at its role, and its power, in this election. This "candidate" is an unprecedented threat to every American freedom and human right this country has come to stand for. If little donnie somehow makes it into the Oval Office, there is a real possibility that over the course of a few years we will see the USA disintegrate.

In that dark future it is more than possible -- it is highly probable that there will be neither journalistic privilege nor legal protections left under which a nominally-free press can exist. How will the Nytimes fare under a Putin-inspired "democratic" dictatorship? Chances are some of your staff will end up in the gulag.

Think on it. It is highly irresponsible to be calling, suggesting, or even hinting that Hilary has taken this election. Stand back and have a look at yourself, NYtimes. No one is forcing you to foster overconfidence and complacency among your readers.

little donnie needs to be buried in a +25% Clinton landslide.

Yeah, it's over. And thankfully so. By his own implicit admission the decisive threshold of Trump and Trump's mini-me throng's windbaggery has been reached and exceeded. Not even Trump can stand himself any more and he is actively planning a "very long" and "very nice" vacation after having led large sections of the public and media on a rather bizarre, extended personal romp. It's been a fun-fest that has succeeded in trashing one of the two major political parties in America. The next three months will be an anti-climax as the electorate yawns and does a pre-vote with their channel changers. Trump and his Dr. Evil groupies have been doing a low-class, Mike Myers imitation for over a year now. That's a level of unmitigated plagiarism that puts even Melania completely to shame. Trumps' impending repudiation by the voting public will be a ringing judgement of the complete absence of any artistic merit attached to his or his acolytes efforts. This has truly been an exercise in sound and fury signifying absolutely nothing. So long Big Daddy.

The national polls really aren't worth much. It comes down to the state ballots, since the only voting that really counts is the Electoral College. That said, let's hope that the Democrats do not become to satisfied, because the real challenge is to take back Congress. If the R T-publcans control the House, we will have more of what we have had for the last 8 years. While it is a long shot, the Dems could get the house. A much better chance lies in the Senate. And, in some ways, more important, since they get to "advise and consent" on the SCOTUS nominations (something they seem to be derelict in doing now). So, Dems, don't be overconfident. Get out and vote the down ballot elections.

Reading this, a certain Republican President's quotes come to mind:
"America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves."
You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time."
American voters - Republican and Democrats alike - need to take stock of these very wise words and ACT ON THEM.

Trump will win with the largest voting block, independents, despite his temperament, lack of qualifications, etc. We dislike and distrust the Clinton. She is a liar and never comes clean. We would have voted for Bloomberg (why didn't he run?). This country has a problem with trade, illegal immigrants who destroy our culture by not assimilating, and terrorism, among others.

I appreciate the upshot -- the analysis, the predictions, etc. But, from a another point of view -- if you know nothing about football, and don;t care) (I only watch baseball games and follow the Cubs), I haven't a clue what you mean about field goals, etc. Please explain.

Two defective candidates with identical low trust and favorable ratings make this election cycle as a referendum on who do you hate the least. Yes, Hillary is, on paper, i an accomplished candidate but she has unresolved issues that still linger; her emails; her foundation and her years as Secretary of state. Issues that are eclipsed by Donald Trump's Herculean ego and his cavernous  mouth. The issues have taken a secondary role to Trump's buffoonery and boorish behavior. This election has an accomplished liar who is ethically challenged, who will say and do anything to fulfill her obsession with the presidential office. On the other hand you have a braggart, impulsive and irrational; challenges anyone who disagrees with him  Perhaps it is time to re-evaluate the electoral processes ... this cannot be the best it has to offer?
“…[this] model has no idea whether the quarterback of the trailing team is Peyton Manning or Ryan Leaf.” Oh, how awful, how mean! (I’m laughing, laughing, laughing—you naughty man!
Polls? You mean those things that only call around 300 people and only on a home phone line? Nobody believes those anything, ie brexit.

I remember too many old races and too many old pols to believe that the race is settled. It's Hillary's to lose, but Trump is not dead in the water.

Hillary's lead over Trump is sometimes said to be 8-11 points; Cohn suggests it might be 7 points.

I have seen much bigger leads collapse.

Just look at a few elections:

1) Cohn notes that Humphrey shrunk Nixon's lead in 1968, but Cohn ignores vital details. In September 1968, Humphrey was at 29 percent while Nixon was about 43 percent. That 14 point lead was almost entirely erased: The final tally (According to Theodore's White Making of the President 1968): Nixon: 43.4 %; Humphrey: 42.7 %. If Humphrey can lop off a 14 point lead from September to November, Trump can close a 7 or 8 point lead from August to November.

2) Cohn briefly alludes to 1976, but the predictive moral of that election seems to escape him. The day after the Dem Convention, Carter was 30 points ahead of Ford. Carter won by 2 points. Carter's 30 point lead vaporized. (Which was amazing given Ford's famously abysmal debate performance)

3) The day after the Dem convention in 1984, Mondale was practically tied with Reagan. On election day, he was violated by a margin of about 60 to 40 percent.

Huge swings in political sentiments have transpired. Trump could still pull it off. But he needs psychiatric intervention STAT

We are the Big Ten,not rust belt states. We are Minnesota,Wisconsin,Michigan,Pennsylvania,Ohio,Illinois,Iowa and Indiana.We have raised our children to achieve their best because our parents and grandparents gave us moral values.
I hope the term rust belt will go away forever.

comments.userDisplayName: John from the Wind Turbine City
comments.commentBody: Two words: Michael Dukakis. The hapless Democrat left the Democratic national convention with double-digit leads int the polls. Then Bush the First snapped into action. Willie Hortion. The infamous foto of Mike riding a tank with a goofy helmet. The wife rape question. So we got Bush and Clarence Thomas; Bush I became a one termer who lost to Bill Clinton because Ross Perot, who was right about the giant sucking sound of jobs going to Mexico in NAFTA , sapped GOP votes. There is plenty of time for Clinton II to lose. I have gone down with McGovern, Carter, Mondale, and all the rest of the down-tickets.  Hillary Clinton is NOT talking about ordinary jobs for ordinary people. Targeted tax cuts are stinkers and she remains very vulnerable.

No matter what the polls say, I will relax only when Hillary Clinton has 270 votes.  And please do not compare Donald Trump with either Hubert Humphrey or Gerald Ford.  Above all else, Humphrey and Ford were decent, honorable human beings.  The same cannot be said for Mr. Trump.
Will someone please share this information with Maureen Dowd?

Trump viciously attacks anyone who questions the hateful things he says, and rarely addresses the content of a good question. He appears ignorant of the most fundamental parts of governance and he never expresses regret for any hurt he causes anyone. Could America actaully elect someone who is potentially a sociopath or possibly even a psychopath? It’s bizarre to even ask the question but the possibility seens completely real.
From MedicalDaily.com: “According to Dr. L. Michael Tompkins, a psychologist at the Sacramento County Mental Health Treatment Center, the difference lies in having a conscience. A psychopath simply doesn’t have one, he told WebMD. They will steal from you without feeling a twinge of guilt — though they may pretend to if they’re caught, so they aren’t “found out.” A sociopath, on the other hand, will understand that taking your money is wrong and may feel remorse, but it won’t be enough to stop their deviant behavior. A psychopath has less regard for others than a sociopath.”
Unfortunately the description appears to fit.
In this context Hillary is a very “normal” person. Definitely a politician, but she knows right from wrong, has a strong knowledge of governance and a sense of empathy. There is a world of difference. It’s astonishing that Trump has got this far but people need to understand that he has an unstable personality and represents a real potential danger to America.. & the world for that matter, and cannot get anywhere near the WH.

Regardless if Hillary Clinton is ahead in the polls NOW, we need to remain focused, continue to register voters, connect ALL the down-ballot GOP candidates to Donald Trump, and most importantly...make sure that voters get out and vote on Election Day.
While it looks good for Clinton, and very bad for trump now, and even though Trump is claiming the media is to blame for his low numbers, we can not trust it is over until it IS OVER and Hillary Rodham Clinton is the 45th president of the USA.
